Sequence Information.Peptide Name: K4K20S4 (Dermaseptin-S4 M4K,N20K analog, Ala-rich, Synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, AMPHIBIAN, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (92.86%) toDermaseptin-S4A: 32%; L=K: 21%.Activity: active against A. baumannii (MIC 3.125 ug/ml). MBC: 6.25 ug/ml.virus: it also inhibits Zika virus  (ZIKV) (IC50 0.42 ug/ml ) (Haddad et al., 2024).Toxicity: Hep-2 Cells (LC50 75.71 ug/ml).  Updated 7/2024

Literature Information.Title: Evaluation of the Antibacterial Activity of New Dermaseptin Derivatives against Acinetobacter baumannii.
